meanings.definition: The number and visual appearance of the chromosomes in the cell nucleus of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the karyotype of the cell under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The karyotype of a human typically consists of 46 chromosomes.
meanings.sent3: The karyotype of the fruit fly looked like a colorful necklace under the lens.
meanings.sent4: Her karyotype was like a genetic blueprint, revealing her unique traits.
meanings.sent5: The karyotype, like a genetic map, guided the researchers in their study.

meanings.definition: The characterization of the chromosome complement of a cell or organism, including the number, form, and size of the chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: Doctors use karyotype analysis to identify genetic disorders in patients.
meanings.sent2: The karyotype of the plant showed an unusual pattern of chromosome distribution.
meanings.sent3: The karyotype of the mouse was so detailed, it seemed like a genetic puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The karyotype, like a genetic fingerprint, revealed the individual's unique genetic makeup.
meanings.sent5: Studying the karyotype was like deciphering a genetic code for the researchers.
